surepy.data.filter module¶

Methods for filtering LocData objects.

surepy.data.filter.exclude_sparce_points(selection, threshold_density, **kwargs)[source]¶

Exclude localizations by thresholding a local density.

Parameters:
  • selection (Selection) – specifying the localization data on which to perform the manipulation.
  • threshold_density (float) – all points with a local density below the threshold will be excluded.
Returns:

a new instance of Selection referring to the same Dataset as the input Selection.
Return type:

Selection
surepy.data.filter.select_by_condition(locdata, condition, **kwargs)[source]¶

Select by specifying conditions on data properties.

Parameters:
  • locdata (LocData) – Specifying the localization data from which to select localization data.
  • condition (string) – Conditions as input in select method. More precise: query specifications to be used with pandas query.
Returns:

a new instance of LocData referring to the specified dataset.
Return type:

LocData
surepy.data.filter.select_by_image_mask(selection, mask, pixel_size, **kwargs)[source]¶

Select by masking using a binary image(e.g. generated by thresholding a transmitted-light microscopy image.

Parameters:
  • selection (Selection) – specifying the localization data from which to select localization data.
  • mask – binary image.
  • pixel_size (tuple(float)) – pixel sizes for each dimension in units of localization coordinates.
Returns:

a new instance of Selection referring to the specified dataset.
Return type:

Selection
surepy.data.filter.select_by_region(selection, region, **kwargs)[source]¶

Select localizations within specified rectangle, circle, polygon or 3D equivalents.

Parameters:
  • selection (Selection) – specifying the localization data from which to select localization data.
  • region – region of interest.
Returns:

a new instance of Selection referring to the specified dataset.
Return type:

Selection
